dublin_core.dcvalue: A standardized dermatology vocabulary is central to our collective ability to gather clinical information consistently for patient care to retrieve information for research or disease management as well as to conduct outcomes analysis for quality improvement The deficiencies of current classifications have been recognized by the National Institute of Arthritis and Musculoskeletal and Skin Diseases NIAMS in their decision to fund the development of a standard complete reference terminology for dermatology The Dermatology Lexicon will have a major impact both on clinical care and on dermatologic research Accuracy in medical records and telemedicine communications will be improved Reliable terminology will provide for more complete and consistent documentation and data aggregation and reporting In order to create a useful sustainable lexicon involvement of the dermatology community is essential
Journal of the American Academy of Dermatology
Framework for improved communication: the Dermatology Lexicon Project.
